content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cool one!

I have made few changes in the description.

1) Removed "." before "In this case..." statement.
2) Made "Note" in bold.
3) "evenness" -> "oddness" since actually we are checking odd number of "-" and added note regarding this.

Here is my Python solution.

for _ in range(int(input())):
    s = input()
    n = s.count('-')
    s = s.replace('+','').replace('-','')
    if n%2>0: print(0 if int(s) == 0 else -1*int(s))
    else: print(int(s))

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice one, I quite like it :)

Your logic for determining whether or not a number has indeed a minus sign or not is not obvious to me at all.
It is unclear when you say "There are some extra signs" whether you mean those are added to the left of the sign only (ie -45 -> ++-45) or at random places (+-+45). The test cases point to the latter but it therefore makes the determination of sign somewhat arbitrary.
In any case you should clearly specify how the sign is to be determined.

It was certainly not clear.
If the number of "-"s is odd, then it is a negative number.
